rules: NEVER use AI attribution in commit messages (no 'Generated with Claude Code' or Co-Authored-By lines)
Always read existing files before making changes
Prefer editing existing files over creating new ones when possible
Use TodoWrite tool to track progress on complex tasks
Follow established git workflow and branch naming conventions
Reference issue numbers in commits when applicable
Update ALL affected documentation proactively without being asked
Test that changes don't break existing functionality
documentation_checklist: Getting started guides if user experience changes
Docker compose comments for new services

always_include: Reference to issue numbers when applicable
Clear description of what changed and why

workflow_principles.scope_boundaries: Ask for clarification when scope is unclear
workflow_principles.technical_approach: Propose options when multiple paths exist
workflow_principles.dependencies: Stop and ask when blockers are found
workflow_principles.testing: Include appropriate test coverage for changes

repository_context.structure: loqalabs/ contains multiple individual git repositories

cross_repo_workflow.simple_changes: Make directly to main branch of supporting repos
cross_repo_workflow.complex_changes: Create matching feature branches across affected repos
cross_repo_workflow.merge_order: Supporting repos first, primary repo last

best_practices: Make changes easy to find and understand later
avoid: Making changes without understanding current state
Creating new files when editing existing ones works
Over-analyzing ideas that just need to be captured
